meanings.definition: The quality or state of being indissoluble.
meanings.sent1: The indissolubility of the glue ensured the pieces stayed together.
meanings.sent2: The indissolubility of the bond between the two friends was evident in their unwavering support for each other.
meanings.sent3: The indissolubility of the marriage contract led to many humorous misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like the indissolubility of a strong magnet, always drawing them back together.
meanings.sent5: The indissolubility of the rock-solid foundation kept the building standing tall through the storm.

meanings.definition: The inability to be dissolved or separated.
meanings.sent1: The indissolubility of the sugar cube in water surprised the students during the science experiment.
meanings.sent2: The indissolubility of the ancient artifact made it a challenge for archaeologists to study.
meanings.sent3: The indissolubility of the tangled headphones caused much amusement among the group.
meanings.sent4: Their love was like the indissolubility of a strong adhesive, impossible to break apart.
meanings.sent5: The indissolubility of the team's spirit carried them through tough times and victories alike.
